mod-mol.name: Gpa1
mod-mol.user-doc: Binding between Gpa1 and GDP is said to be stabilized by binding of Gpa1 to Ste4. Also, there is no binding site for Sst2, which does hydrolysis on Gpa1 only when in the Sst2-Ste2-Gpa1 bridging complex.

binding-site.name: to-Ste2
binding-site.user-doc: Affinity between Gpa1 and Ste2 is said to be increased by Gpa1's being bound to Ste4; the Ste4-bound shape brings about this increase in binding affinity.

binding-site.name: to-Ste4
binding-site.user-doc: The binding site between Gpa1 and Ste4 is affected both by binding of Gpa1 to pheromone-bound receptor and by binding of Gpa1 to GTP/GDP. These shape changes are assumed to affect only off-rates.

binding-site.name: to-GXP
binding-site.user-doc: Changes in the shape of the nucleotide (GTP/GDP) binding site because Gpa1's being bound to active receptor is how nucleotide exchange is achieved in this model. When Gpa1 is bound to Ste4, its binding to GDP is also said to be enhanced.

mod-mol.name: Sst2
mod-mol.user-doc: Sst2 is said to interact with Gpa1 only in complex with Ste2 in the Wiki, and no direct binding is described between Sst2 and Gpa1.

binding-site.name: to-MAPK
binding-site.user-doc: Binding site assumes the obstructed shape when Sst2 is bound to Ste2.

binding-site.name: to-Ste2
binding-site.user-doc: Binding site assumes the obstructed shape when Sst2 is bound to MAPK.

binding-site.name: to-Gpa1
binding-site.user-doc: Binding site assumes the obstructed shape when Ste4 binds Ste5, or when Ste4 binds Ste20, blocking or inhibiting binding to Gpa1.

binding-site.name: to-Ste5
binding-site.user-doc: Binding site assumes the obstructed shape when Ste4 is bound to Gpa1, inhibiting or preventing binding to Ste5. This site is unaffected by binding of Ste4 to Ste20.

binding-site.name: to-Ste20
binding-site.user-doc: Binding site assumes the obstructed shape when Ste4 is bound to Gpa1, preventing or inhibiting binding to Ste20. This site is unaffected by Ste4 binding to Ste5.

mod-mol.name: Ste11
mod-mol.user-doc: Ste11 binding to Fus3, and in particular, competitive binding between Ste5 and Fus3 to Ste11, is not included in this model.

mod-site.name: Ste20-phosphorylation-site
mod-site.user-doc: This site recieves all the phosphorylations from Ste20, and can be doubly- or triply-phosphorylated. This essentially follows the wiki's approach.

mod-mol.name: Ste7
mod-mol.user-doc: Here, I have simplified the way in which binding between Ste7 and Fus3 is mutually exclusive with binding between Ste7 and Ste5: Just using the same binding site on Ste7 for both bindings. This is not the same as it's done in the wiki.

binding-site.name: target-site
binding-site.user-doc: Binding between Ste7 and Fus3 is competitive with Ste7 binding to Ste5 and with Fus3 binding to Ste5. To simplify this model, I am arranging this mutual exclusivity of binding by using the same binding site on Ste7 to bind Ste5 or either MAPK, Fus3 or Kss1. This way, mutual exclusion works the same way on both the Fus3/Kss1 side and the Ste7 side.

mod-mol.name: Fus3
mod-mol.user-doc: Binding of Fus3 to Ste7 prevents binding of Ste7 to Ste5 and prevents binding of Fus3 to Ste5. On the Fus3 side, according to the wiki, Ste7 and Ste5 have to literally share a single binding site, called just 'target-site' in the wiki model.

allosteric-omni.user-doc: Competitive binding to Ste4 by Gpa1 and Ste5. Here, binding of Ste4 to Ste5 makes binding of Ste4 to Gpa1 impossible.
Competitive binding to Ste4 by Gpa1 and Ste20. Here, Ste20 binding to Ste4 obstructs binding of Gpa1 to Ste4.
Competitive binding to Ste4 by Gpa1. Here, Gpa1 binding to Ste4 obstructs binding of Ste4 to both Ste5 and Ste20. Also, Gpa1 binding to Ste2 is tightened when Gpa1 is bound to Ste4.
Gpa1 dissociation from Ste4. This allosteric omni models the change of shape in Gpa1 that happens when Gpa1 is bound to GDP, in the case that Gpa1 IS bound to Ste2.

Gpa1 dissociation from Ste4. This allosteric omni models the change of shape in Gpa1 that happens when Gpa1 is bound to GTP, causing it to lose affinity for Ste4, in the case that Gpa1 IS bound to Ste2.

Gpa1 dissociation from Ste4. This allosteric omni models the change of shape in Gpa1 that happens when Gpa1 is bound to GTP, causing it to lose affinity for Ste4, in the case that Gpa1 is not bound to Ste2.
Gpa1 dissociation from Ste4. This allosteric omni models the change of shape in Gpa1 that happens when Gpa1 is bound to GDP, in the case that Gpa1 is not bound to Ste2.

dimerization-gen.user-doc: Ste2-Sst2 binding. This model does not include Yck1 or Yck2, or is this binding inhibited by Ste2 phosphorylated by Yck1 or Yck2.
Gpa1 binding to Ste2. Being complexed with Ste4 causes Gpa1 to bind more tightly to Ste2; here, this is achieved by reducing the off-rate. These rates do not seem to be in the Wiki.
Gpa1 binding to GDP. Note that this is 10 fold tighter than binding to GTP.
Gpa1 binding to GTP. Note that this is 10 fold looser than binding to GDP.

omni-gen.user-doc: Gpa1 auto-hydrolysis reaction. This reaction should be assisted by another involving Sst2.

dimerization-gen.user-doc: Gpa1 binding to Ste4. Modified by whether Gpa1 is bound to GTP or GDP and by whether Gpa1 is bound to the alpha receptor Ste2 or not. Binding between Ste4 and Gpa1 is also competitive with binding between Ste4 and Ste5.
Ste20 binding to Ste4. Using typical on- and off-rates, as none are in the wiki at this point. The allo-rates here are supposed to mean 'Ste2 will not bind to Ste4 when Ste4 is bound to Gpa1.'

omni-gen.user-doc: Ste20 phosphorylation of Ste11. This reaction goes from no phosphorylation to single phosphorylation.
Ste20 phosphorylation of Ste11. This reaction goes from single phosphorylation to double phosphorylation.
Ste20 phosphorylation of Ste11. This reaction goes from double phosphorylation to triple phosphorylation.

dimerization-gen.user-doc: Ste11 binding to Ste5. Binding of Ste11 to Fus3, along with its effect on Ste11 binding to Ste5, is not in this model. Using typical rates here; none in the wiki.

omni-gen.user-doc: Ste11 phosphorylation of Ste7; Ste11 singly phosphorylated. Here, since we do not model Ste5 dimerization or oligomerization, we require that Ste11 phosphorylates Ste7 only in cis on the same Ste5. The wiki gives no argument that this is not the case in fact. It suggests that in cis and in trans are not compatible, but it apparently does not give a reason to prefer either. Also note that, in this model, Ste7 gets only one phosphorylation from Ste11, instead of two as in the wiki model. The wiki model does not seem to include inhibitory back-phosphorylation of Ste7 by Fus3.

Ste11 phosphorylation of Ste7; Ste11 doubly phosphorylated. Here, since we do not model Ste5 dimerization or oligomerization, we require that Ste11 phosphorylates Ste7 only in cis on the same Ste5. The wiki gives no argument that this is not the case in fact. It suggests that in cis and in trans are not compatible, but it apparently does not give a reason to prefer either. Also note that, in this model, Ste7 gets only one phosphorylation from Ste11, instead of two as in the wiki model. The wiki model does not seem to include inhibitory back-phosphorylation of Ste7 by Fus3.

Ste11 phosphorylation of Ste7; Ste11 triply phosphorylated. Here, since we do not model Ste5 dimerization or oligomerization, we require that Ste11 phosphorylates Ste7 only in cis on the same Ste5. The wiki gives no argument that this is not the case in fact. It suggests that in cis and in trans are not compatible, but it apparently does not give a reason to prefer either. Also note that, in this model, Ste7 gets only one phosphorylation from Ste11, instead of two as in the wiki model. The wiki model does not seem to include inhibitory back-phosphorylation of Ste7 by Fus3.

uni-mol-gen.user-doc: Dephosphorylation of Ste7 activating site. That is, the site phophorylated by Ste11. For now, this model differs from the wiki model in not going on to a second phosphorylation of Ste7.

dimerization-gen.user-doc: Ste7 binding to Ste5. In this simplification, Ste7 binds to Ste5 at the same binding site as Ste7 binds to MAPK, either Fus3 or Kss1.

Ste7 binding to Fus3. In this model, Ste7 and Fus3 bind to each other with the same sites that they bind to Ste5. In the wiki model, this is only the case for Fus3, while Ste7 has separate binding sites for Fus3 and Ste5.

omni-gen.user-doc: Ste7 phosphorylation of Fus3; first site on Fus3. As a simplification in this model, Ste7 needs only one phosphorylation by Ste11 to be activated. There is also the unresolved back-phosphorylation issue. Ste7 phosphorylates the two sites on Fus3 independently.

Ste7 phosphorylation of Fus3; second site on Fus3. As a simplification in this model, Ste7 needs only one phosphorylation by Ste11 to be activated. There is also the unresolved back-phosphorylation issue. Ste7 phosphorylates the two sites on Fus3 independently.

plex-species.name: ATP-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This population is unsupported. Intended to be plenty.

plex-species.name: GTP-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This population is unsupported. Intended to be plenty.

plex-species.name: ADP-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This population is unsupported. Intended to be plenty.

plex-species.name: GDP-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This population is unsupported. Intended to be plenty.

stoch-species.name: phosphate
stoch-species.user-doc: This population is unsupported. Intended to be plenty.

stoch-species.name: phosphatase-X
stoch-species.user-doc: This species is intended to carry out non-specific dephosphorylation.

plex-species.name: Gpa1-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This 9000 is from the wiki, differing from my early number from Kirsten. In my earlier models, I've always started with Gpa1 loaded up with GDP; here, starting with all singleton molecules, to go along with what is being said in the Wiki.

plex-species.name: Ste4-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This 9000 is from the Wiki, differing from my early number from Kirsten.

plex-species.name: Sst2-singleton
plex-species.user-doc: This number is unsupported. Nothing in wiki.
